lines.text: Microwave lasagna. Possibly nature's most perfect food.
Kids don't want to see a cartoon about a cat.
They're culturally deprived.
They used to call me "No-Hit Arbuckle".
But only when he was at bat.
Someone's slinging mud!
And it's nowhere near Election Day.

[on show intro]
Hey, Heathcliff! Eat your heart out!
Sell your remote control. I'm the best thing on.

[commercial bumper]
Here are some commercials and then, more of me.
Arbuckle! Remember the a la mode!
It's another one of...
[shouts]
Garfield's Tales of Scary Stuff!

[singing]
Does your nose look like a banana?/Are your toes shaped like Indiana?/Do your ears seem bigger than Montana?/Dry your tears, we understand you/
[talking]
Hey everyone has something strange about them, that's what makes us special/Wouldn't it be great if you could look in the mirror and say/
[singing]

Yo banana nose! Now you know how my sailboat goes/Here's Montana ears, I have ears so my sister can steer/Hey hey hey Indiana toes, getting me across those winter snows/Whatever the name, I'm still the same nice person.

[Odie takes him to a head of cabbage, after telling him it was a watch]
Odie, that is not a watch, it's a head of cabbage, there is a difference. You do not tell time with a watch, you make cole slaw out of it.
[Odie groans]
Odie, you have a head of cabbage!

[crash, Odie whines]
Either Jon's home or someone's put a VCR down the garbage disposer.
Think of a number between 1 and 10. The number you think of is 7.
Hey Heathcliff eat your heart out!
Smart kids watch this show other kids change the channel.
After seven seasons we've pretty much said everything you can say in this spot.

[commercial bumper]
"Garfield and Friends" will be right back. At least, I'll be.
